pages.text: When one finds oneself lost, or unable to find one's way, it can be difficult to keep a cool head - $(italic)a phrase here which means to stay calm in a difficult situation$() - and in some difficult situations, it may not only be difficult to stay calm, it may also be difficult to survive.

Should you find yourself in a difficult situation, the Pyrotechnic Esoterica contains many techniques and ideas that - through the act of starting fires rather than putting them out - will serve to dramatically increase the likelihood of your survival.$(p)One such technique or idea is that of the $(item)Campfire$().

A $(item)Campfire$() is an indispensable component to wilderness survival and, as such, the knowledge required to construct a $(item)Campfire$() is a cornerstone in each new volunteer's wilderness survival library.

When huddled together in the dead of night $(italic)- a phrase here which means a time in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest -$() a $(item)Campfire$() can be used to heighten anticipation and dread while recreationally engaging in scintillating yet predictable tales of horror and misfortune.$(br)  However, for a person in your predicament, heightening anticipation and dread for recreational enjoyment is probably not a priority.

For a person in your predicament, a person engaged in the horror and misfortune of wilderness survival in a very non-recreational, non-scintillating, and unpredictable way, $(info) a $(item)Campfire$() is most useful for cooking food and creating light$() - light that will act as a comfort against the anticipation and dread that is inevitably heightened in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest.

This guide, also being an indispensable component to wilderness survival and a cornerstone in each new volunteer's wilderness survival library, naturally contains the necessary knowledge required to construct and make use of just such a $(item)Campfire$().

To construct a $(item)Campfire$(), follow these four easy steps:$(p)  $(l:survive/introduction#craft_tinder)1. Craft Tinder$()$(br)  $(l:survive/introduction#place_tinder)2. Place Tinder$()$(br)  $(l:survive/introduction#add_logs)3. Add logs$()$(br)  $(l:survive/introduction#ignite)4. Ignite$()

pages.title: 1. Craft Tinder
pages.text: First, you will need some $(item)Tinder$() - $(italic)a word here which means a dry, flammable material, such as sticks or plant fibers, that is often used to aid in lighting a fire$() - to aid in lighting your fire.

Finally, use any $(l:appendix/ignition)verified fire-starter device$() to ignite.$(p)$(italic)~ Author's Notes:$()$(p)I have used a $(item)Campfire$() very similar to the one illustrated here and it is because of this experience, or rather your inexperience, that I would like to tell you that the experience of cooking on an open flame is a joyous one, but I cannot.

What I can tell you, from the experience of many hungry nights, is that $(info) food left cooking unattended will burn.$(p)I can also tell you that $(info) a shovel is required to remove ash and that $(info) a $(item)Campfire$() can be extinguished by rain or a bucket of water.
